entry.title: Eshmunazar II (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the sarcophagus of Eshmunazar II (pictured), the Phoenician king of Sidon, is one of only three ancient Egyptian sarcophagi unearthed outside Egypt?

entry.title: Herb Dell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that NFL head coach Herb Dell also officiated games of the team he coached?

entry.title: Nizza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nizza in central Frankfurt is one of the largest gardens of Mediterranean plants north of the Alps, thanks to its very warm microclimate?

entry.title: T. K. Jones (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that T. K. Jones thought that a nuclear war was survivable if "there are enough shovels to go around"?

entry.title: 19.99 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 19.99 was intended to be a serious Jewish hip hop album, but reviewers largely treated it as parody?

entry.title: Honour Chen-Williams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vera Chok asked producers to place a rice cooker in the set of the home of her character, Honour Chen-Williams?

entry.title: This Boy's Life (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in his memoir This Boy's Life, Tobias Wolff writes about his childhood misdeeds including stealing and forging checks?

entry.title: a game about the Syrian civil war (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a journalist created a game about the Syrian civil war after observing that Miley Cyrus got more clicks than the war?
